title: With two new cases in a day, HMPV count rises to five in Gujarat - The Indian Express
summary:
With two new cases in a day, HMPV count rises to five in Gujarat

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

A nine-month-old child and a 59-year-old man have tested positive for human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Gujarat, bringing the total number of cases in the state to five. All cases have been reported in less than a week.

  • All five cases were confirmed within a week starting from January 6.
  • The first case was a two-month-old boy from Rajasthan.
  • Symptoms of HMPV include fever, nasal congestion, runny nose, and cough.
  • The virus spreads through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces.
The pathogen spreads through respiratory droplets from coughing or sneezing...

As cases of HMPV rise in Gujarat, health officials are monitoring the situation closely and promoting awareness about the virus.
newTitle: Gujarat Sees Rise in HMPV Cases with Two New Infections

Elderly man from Kutch tested HMPV positive making Gujarat’s fifth case - Gujarat Samachar
summary:
Elderly Man in Kutch Tests Positive for HMPV, Increasing Gujarat's Cases to Five

Publication Date: Jan 12th, 2025 | Source: Gujarat Samachar

A 59-year-old man from Kutch has been confirmed with Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Ahmedabad, marking the fifth reported case in Gujarat.

  • The patient, who has no travel history, is receiving treatment at Zydus Hospital in Ahmedabad.
  • Previous cases include a 2-month-old infant and an 8-year-old child, highlighting the virus's spread among vulnerable populations.
  • The Gujarat government has issued health advisories to prevent further spread of the virus, emphasizing precautions during winter.
  • HMPV, first detected in 2001, typically resembles cold or flu symptoms and usually doesn't require hospitalization.
Experts suggest, 'Most HMPV cases do not require hospitalization, and there’s no need to panic.'

The health department stresses the importance of following safety measures to limit respiratory infections, particularly in the upcoming winter months.
newTitle: Elderly Man in Kutch Tests Positive for HMPV, Increasing Gujarat's Cases to Five

title: Galaxy S25 Ultra: Everything we know so far about Samsung’s next flagship smartphone - The Indian Express
summary:
Galaxy S25 Ultra: Everything We Know So Far About Samsung’s Next Flagship Smartphone

Publication Date: January 19, 2025

Source: Indian Express

The Galaxy S25 Ultra is set to launch on January 22, 2025, and is rumored to feature incremental updates over its predecessor, including a new ultra-wide camera and a powerful processor.

  • Maintains similar design with minor tweaks, including a boxier shape and improved brightness on a 6.9-inch display.
  • Quad-camera setup with upgraded 50 MP ultra-wide lens; retains 200 MP primary and 10 MP telephoto lenses.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite, with options for up to 1 TB storage and 12 GB RAM.
  • Ships with Android 15-based OneUI 7 and promises seven years of updates.
  • Includes a 5,000 mAh battery with 45W fast charging.
  • Expected pricing between Rs 1,20,000 to Rs 1,30,000.
"Samsung seems to be playing it safe when it comes to battery and fast charging."

The Galaxy S25 Ultra is poised to be a strong contender in the premium smartphone market, building on the solid foundation of its forerunners.
newTitle: Galaxy S25 Ultra: Everything We Know About Samsung’s Next Flagship Smartphone

title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh suffer fresh blow after Shakib Al Hasan fails 2nd bowling action test in Chennai - Mint
summary:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh suffer fresh blow after Shakib Al Hasan fails 2nd bowling action test in Chennai

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Bangladesh and their star all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan faced another setback for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 as Shakib failed his second bowling action test in Chennai. He will be able to play as a batsman but remains suspended from bowling.

  • Shakib was first reported for a suspect bowling action during a match in September.
  • He failed his first test in the UK at Loughborough University on December 15, 2024.
  • The Sri Ramachandra Centre for Sports Science in Chennai confirmed the failure of the second assessment.
  • Captain Najmul Hossain Shanto and BCB president Faruque Ahmed support Shakib's inclusion in the squad.
  • Bangladesh's Champions Trophy campaign begins against India on February 20, requiring squad announcements by January 12.
“A successful reassessment is required for the bowling suspension to be lifted.” - BCB statement

This news adds to the challenges for Bangladesh as they prepare for a crucial tournament, with Shakib's experience being vital despite his ongoing suspension.
newTitle: Shakib Al Hasan Fails Bowling Test Ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025

title: Delhi CM Atishi launches crowdfunding campaign, says need ₹40 lakh to fight election - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi CM Atishi Launches Crowdfunding Campaign for Election

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Atishi, the Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party candidate for the Kalkaji seat, has initiated a crowdfunding campaign to raise ₹40 lakh for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections. She emphasized the importance of public support in her previous political endeavors.

  • Atishi expressed her need for financial assistance to fight the elections.
  • She highlighted the AAP's reliance on small donations from the public.
  • Atishi addressed past support from constituents and urged for continued backing.
  • The Delhi Assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, with votes counting on February 8.
  • The AAP aims for a third consecutive term after winning 67 and 62 seats in the last two elections.
“Over the past 5 years, you've stood by me as an MLA, a minister, and now as the Chief Minister of Delhi. None of this would have been possible without your blessings and support.” - Atishi

The AAP continues its campaign focusing on work and honesty, with previous crowdfunding efforts by its leaders.
newTitle: Delhi CM Atishi Launches Crowdfunding Campaign for Election

EAM Jaishankar's attendance marks an important moment in India-US relations as the new administration takes office.

Stay inside to avoid toxic smoke: Los Angeles wildfire death toll rises to 16; residents warned

8 stunning, beautiful images of Red Planet 'Mars' by NASA - India.com
summary:
8 Stunning Images of Mars Captured by NASA

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: India.com

This article features breathtaking images of Mars taken by NASA, showcasing the Red Planet's unique landscapes and phenomena.

  • The images include snapshots from the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter and the Hubble Space Telescope.
  • One image shows a carbon dioxide ice cap at the South Pole of Mars with “spiders” emerging in spring.
  • A composite Hubble image highlights the passage of comet Siding Spring near Mars.
  • Several images depict the effects of global dust storms on Mars' surface.
  • Other captures illustrate Martian dune fields and frost avalanches.
“NASA has relied on HiRISE to study another quirk of Martian springtime: gas geysers that blast out of the surface.”

The collection of images illustrates the dynamic and visually stunning nature of the Martian environment.
newTitle: 8 Stunning Images of Mars Captured by NASA

title: EAM Jaishankar to represent India at Donald Trump's swearing-in on January 20 - Hindustan Times
summary:
EAM Jaishankar to Attend Trump's Inauguration on January 20

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will represent India at the swearing-in ceremony of President-elect Donald J. Trump as the 47th President of the United States.

  • Jaishankar will engage in meetings with representatives of the incoming administration and other dignitaries.
  • The swearing-in ceremony will occur on January 20 at noon Eastern Time at the Capitol in Washington, D.C.
  • The theme for the inauguration is “Our Enduring Democracy: A Constitutional Promise.”
“On the invitation of the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee, External Affairs Minister (EAM) Dr S. Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the Swearing-In Ceremony of President-Elect Donald J Trump as the 47th President of the United States of America,” - Government Statement

The event marks a significant moment in U.S.-India relations and illustrates the diplomatic engagement during a historic inauguration.
newTitle: EAM Jaishankar to Attend Trump's Inauguration on January 20

title: Jasprit Bumrah in danger of missing entire Champions Trophy because of back injury - The Times of India
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Faces Potential Absence from Champions Trophy Due to Back Injury

Date: February 2024 | Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team may face a significant challenge as their star fast bowler, Jasprit Bumrah, is at risk of missing the upcoming Champions Trophy due to a back injury.

  • Bumrah has been experiencing swelling on his back and will be monitored at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru.
  • The national selectors are awaiting the full medical report before making a decision on Bumrah's selection for the Champions Trophy.
  • The deadline for announcing the squad is Sunday midnight, and it is unclear if Bumrah will be included.
  • In the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Bumrah had an impressive performance but could not bowl on the final day due to the injury.
  • He recently returned from a long injury layoff after undergoing back surgery last year.
“The selectors are yet to get the entire medical report about Bumrah, but at the moment, things don’t look good for him.”

This situation raises concerns about India's bowling lineup as they prepare for a crucial tournament with some key players still recovering from injuries.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Faces Potential Absence from Champions Trophy Due to Back Injury

title: 'Game Changer' box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer mints a whopping Rs 72.5 - TOI Etimes
summary:
Game Changer box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer mints a whopping Rs 72.5 crore

Publication Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Times of India

'Game Changer', directed by Shankar, hit the screens on January 10, 2025, and has garnered significant earnings. The film received positive reviews, especially for Ram Charan's performance.

  • The film grossed Rs 51 crore on its opening day.
  • On the second day, it earned Rs 21.5 crore, bringing the total to Rs 72.5 crore.
  • Second day earnings breakdown: Rs 12.7 crore (Telugu), Rs 7 crore (Hindi), Rs 1.7 crore (Tamil), Rs 10 lakhs (Kannada).
  • The overall occupancy rates were strong, with 31.19% in Telugu theatres.
  • The film features Ram Charan as an IAS officer fighting against corruption.
“The film is likely to dominate the box office during the upcoming festive season.”

The success of 'Game Changer' suggests a promising run at the box office, with expectations of sustained earnings in the weeks to come.
newTitle: Game Changer box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani starrer mints a whopping Rs 72.5 crore

ICC Champions Trophy 2025: New Zealand name uncapped Ben Sears, Mitchell Santner to lead Kiwis in his 1st major event - Mint
summary:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: New Zealand name uncapped Ben Sears, Mitchell Santner to lead Kiwis in his 1st major event

Publication Date: Sunday, Source: Live Mint

New Zealand has announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025, featuring uncapped pacer Ben Sears and led by Mitchell Santner in his first major ICC event.

  • Ben Sears is included as an uncapped pacer in the squad.
  • Mitchell Santner will lead the team in his first major ICC tournament as the full-time captain.
  • The tournament is scheduled to take place in Pakistan starting February 19.
  • New Zealand will play a tri-series in Dubai against Pakistan and South Africa before the tournament.
  • Matt Henry will spearhead the bowling attack alongside Lockie Ferguson.
“It will also be O’Rourke and Smith's maiden senior ICC event.”

New Zealand will depart for Pakistan on February 3.
newTitle: New Zealand Names Squad for ICC Champions Trophy 2025

title: Maha Kumbh Mela set to welcome 400 million pilgrims—three times the population of Russia - Moneycontrol
summary:
Maha Kumbh Mela set to welcome 400 million pilgrims—three times the population of Russia

Date: January 12, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Maha Kumbh Mela, also known as the Great Pitcher Festival, is set to begin in Prayagraj on January 13, with over 400 million people expected to participate over the course of six weeks. This makes it the largest human gathering in the world, drawing devotees from across India and around the globe.

  • The event will feature accommodation in 150,000 temporary tents.
  • It is the largest human gathering, expected to attract three times the population of Russia.
  • The Kumbh Mela is a revered Hindu festival held every three years in four sacred cities.
  • Spiritual benefits such as absolution of sins and salvation are believed to be obtained by participants.
“This makes it the largest human gathering in the world.”

The Maha Kumbh Mela is not just a cultural event; it represents a significant spiritual pilgrimage for millions, reaffirming the values and traditions of Hinduism.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh Mela set to welcome 400 million pilgrims—three times the population of Russia

title: Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan and Kiara Advani’s film sees massive dip, collects Rs 72.5 crore - The Indian Express
summary:
Game Changer Worldwide Box Office Collection Day 2: Ram Charan’s Film Sees Massive Dip

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Indian Express

The political action film Game Changer, starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has witnessed a significant decline in its box office collection on the second day, gathering only Rs 21.5 crore.

  • Day 1 collection was Rs 51 crore, leading to a 57.84% decrease in earnings.
  • Total India gross collection after Day 2 stands at Rs 72.5 crore.
  • The Telugu version earned Rs 53.95 crore, while the Hindi version collected Rs 14.5 crore.
  • The film faced criticism for purportedly inflating its Day 1 earnings to Rs 186 crore.
  • Occupancy rates varied, with the Telugu version at 31.19% and Hindi version at 21.82%.
The king’s arrival is setting the box office ablaze 🤙🏼 #GameChanger takes a blockbuster opening at the BOX OFFICE 💥

The film, directed by Shankar, features an ensemble cast and has caused a stir since its release.
newTitle: Game Changer Worldwide Box Office Collection Day 2: Ram Charan’s Film Sees Massive Dip

title: California wildfires live: Death toll rises to 16 as blaze spreads east to Brentwood - Hindustan Times
summary:
California Wildfires: Death Toll Rises to 16 as Blaze Threatens Brentwood

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Hindustan Times

California's wildfires have become catastrophic, leading to at least 16 fatalities, extensive property damage, and significant evacuations across Los Angeles County as conditions worsen.

  • Unfavorable weather is expected, with Santa Ana winds threatening to exacerbate fire conditions.
  • The Palisades Fire has burned over 22,000 acres, with only 11% contained.
  • More than 1,53,000 residents are under evacuation orders.
  • Firefighters are battling to protect neighborhoods including celebrity homes in Mandeville Canyon.
  • California is receiving support from neighboring states to combat the blazes.
“We're a nervous wreck,” said Sarah Cohen, a local resident.

The wildfires show no signs of slowing, prompting ongoing evacuation orders and raising alarms about air quality as smoke blankets the area.
newTitle: California Wildfires: Death Toll Rises to 16 as Blaze Threatens Brentwood

title: Los Angeles wildfires: 16 dead, Palisades Fire expands as weather change escalates risk - Hindustan Times
summary:
LA wildfires: The Palisades Fire continued to spread northeast, triggering fresh evacuations in affluent Southern California neighbourhoods.

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The death toll from the wildfires in Los Angeles rose to 16, with evacuations triggered in areas like Brentwood and Bel Air. Firefighters are battling the Palisades and Eaton Fires, which have devastated homes.

  • The Palisades Fire has covered 23,600 acres and is only 11% contained; the Eaton Fire is at 15% containment.
  • Six major wildfires have scorched nearly 40,000 acres and destroyed over 12,000 structures.
  • Heightened risk of fire continues due to dry winds.
  • Initial estimates for damages could range from $135 billion to $150 billion, potentially making these wildfires the most expensive in US history.
  • Animal shelters and rescue organizations are assisting displaced animals and their owners.
  • Displaced residents are receiving support in sorting through donated essentials.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding leadership and resource management in firefighting efforts.
  • Reports of looting have led to nighttime curfews and checkpoints.
  • The government has not yet released an official damage estimate, but private predictions indicate tens of billions.
“Another night of unimaginable terror and heartbreak.” - Los Angeles County Supervisor Lindsey Horvath

This disaster is one of the worst crises Los Angeles has faced in decades, highlighting the urgency for effective firefighting resources and community support.
newTitle: Los Angeles Wildfires: 16 Confirmed Dead as Palisades Fire Expands

title: ‘Eagerly awaiting my visit to Sonmarg’: PM Modi reacts to Omar Abdullah’s post ahead of Z-Morh tunnel inauguration - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi Eagerly Awaits Z-Morh Tunnel Inauguration in Sonmarg

Date: Jan 12, 2025 - Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed excitement for his visit to Sonmarg, Jammu and Kashmir, for the inauguration of the Z-Morh tunnel on January 13.

  • Modi will visit at 11.45 am and will inaugurate the 6.5-kilometer tunnel.
  • The tunnel aims to provide year-round connectivity between Kashmir and Sonmarg, benefiting tourism and the local economy.
  • Omar Abdullah, the Jammu and Kashmir chief minister, assessed the preparations and highlighted the tunnel's impact on travel times and winter tourism.
  • The project, initiated in 2012, cost ₹24 billion and is crucial for reducing travel disruptions due to heavy snowfall.
“I am eagerly awaiting my visit to Sonmarg, Jammu and Kashmir for the tunnel inauguration. You rightly point out the benefits for tourism and the local economy.” - PM Modi

The Z-Morh tunnel is expected to open on January 13, enhancing access and promoting year-round tourism in Sonmarg.
newTitle: PM Modi Eagerly Awaits Z-Morh Tunnel Inauguration in Sonmarg

title: Will stock market selloff deepen this week? 6 factors to track - The Economic Times
7 tips to deal with an anxious mind - The Times of India
summary:
7 Tips to Deal with an Anxious Mind

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

An anxious mind can feel overwhelming, especially during stressful situations. However, there are practical techniques you can use to regain control.

  • Try the 4-7-8 breathing technique to calm your breath.
  • Use grounding techniques, such as the 5-4-3-2-1 method, to focus on your senses.
  • Chew gum or snack on crunchy foods to reduce anxiety.
  • Practice Progressive Muscle Relaxation (PMR) to release physical tension.
  • Write a 'worry list' before bed to clear your mind for sleep.
  • Apply cold water to your face to activate calming reflexes.
  • Engage in 'box thinking' to tackle overwhelming thoughts one at a time.
“A simple method is the 4-7-8 breathing technique. Inhale through your nose for 4 seconds, hold your breath for 7 seconds, and exhale slowly for 8 seconds.”

Implementing these techniques can help manage anxiety and promote a sense of calm.
newTitle: 7 Tips to Deal with an Anxious Mind

title: 'Pressure is mounting': Dinesh Karthik on challenges for Gautam Gambhir as India head coach - The Times of India
summary:
Dinesh Karthik Discusses Gautam Gambhir's Challenges as India Head Coach

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

In a recent discussion, Dinesh Karthik highlighted the various challenges that Gautam Gambhir is likely to face as the head coach of the Indian cricket team.

  • Karthik emphasized the pressure of leading a national team.
  • Gambhir's experience as a player could be both a benefit and a burden.
  • Expectations from fans and media will be immense.
  • Karthik noted the importance of strategy and team-building.
“Pressure is mounting,” Karthik stated, acknowledging the high stakes of the head coaching position.

In conclusion, Karthik stresses that while Gambhir has the potential to succeed, the road ahead will require resilience and strategic foresight.
newTitle: Dinesh Karthik Discusses Gautam Gambhir's Challenges as India Head Coach
